intro: Glochidion cenabrei, commonly known as the broadleaf glochidion, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate to elliptic in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in cyathia, a feature typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Glochidion cenabrei is often found in lowland rainforests and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insect species.
